thread.title: SAS heroes foil jihadi bomb plot by urinating in fuel tank
thread.title_full: SAS heroes foil jihadi bomb plot by urinating in fuel tank

title: SAS heroes foil jihadi bomb plot by urinating in fuel tank
text:
Suicide bombers planned to drive the truck into the middle of the market and detonate the explosives to kill up to 100 civilians. 
SAS commandos were ordered to disable the lorry, which was guarded by four sleeping sentries. 
The troops realised they could not take out the vehicle without causing civilian casualties so they urinated into the fuel tanks to make the engine stall. 
GETTY TAKING THE P***: The suicide bombers were shot trying to fox the truck 
Four members of the eight men team crept up to it under the cover of darkness and relieved themselves while the terrorists dozed just feet away. “Troops on the ground were able to improvise and achieve a remarkable result” Anonymous source 
The remaining four commandos did the same before moving to a bomb-damaged building to watch the wagon as it was packed with explosives. 
Just after dawn the terrorists started the lorry but it broke down after only 200 yards. 
Two suicide bombers climbed out and began checking the engine to find out what was wrong. Back to school in Mosul as ISIS are DRIVEN from the city Thursday, 26th January 2017 School kids flocked to register in schools in Mosul as they opened for the first time in 2 years after ISIS are driven from the Iraqi city. 1 / 12 AFP/Getty Images An Iraqi boy sits at a desk at a school in Mosul's eastern Gogjali neighbourhood. 
But moments later they were shot dead by an SAS sniper, who killed both men with head shots from 700 yards away. 
The vehicle was later destroyed by a Javelin anti-tank missile fired by the elite troops. 
Later, the SAS unit reported that up to a ton of explosives had been inside, which could have caused hundreds of casualties if it had been set off. 
GETTY BRAVE: The SAS men urinated in the fuel tank while the jihadis slept metres away 
A source said: “This was a classic SAS operation where the troops on the ground were able to improvise and achieve a remarkable result. 
“The operation was launched on very little information from a trusted source who was able to provide an address of where a lorry bomb was being constructed. 
“The SAS team found the bomb factory but couldn’t disable the vehicle without potentially causing civilian casualties so they decided to contaminate the fuel tank. It worked brilliantly.” Related articles
